Title.En: EdVenture Quest: The Art of CBL through Cases

NoteLiteral.En: CV and a letter of motivation in a pdf format prior to the course. Deadline 31 March 2025

Description.En:
Are you ready to dive into an engaging, interactive learning experience? This short, intensive micromodule on Challenge-Based Learning (CBL) offers a unique opportunity to explore educational materials (videos, articles etc.) at your own pace and collaboratively enhance your understanding in an online (MS Teams) setting. CBL emphasizes teamwork, critical thinking, and real-world problem-solving. All this will be practiced in this course. You will progress through five comprehensive modules designed to build your knowledge and skills on the topic systematically:

**Module 1:** Introduction to Challenge-Based Learning (asynchronous on Lodz University of Technology LMS)) Begin by immersing yourself in the basic concepts and the importance of CBL in contemporary education. 

**Module 2**: The CBL Framework (asynchronous on Lodz University of Technology LMS) Explore the structured approach to implementing CBL, ensuring you grasp its essential components. 

**Module 3:** Questions, Reflection, and Iteration in CBL (synchronous on MS Teams) Learn how to foster a culture of inquiry and adaptive learning within CBL environments. 

**Module 4:** Case-Based Application of CBL (synchronous on MS Teams) Apply your knowledge through real-life case studies, reinforcing the practical aspects of CBL techniques. 

**Module 5:** Communication and Feedback in CBL (synchronous on MS Teams) Enhance your collaborative skills by mastering effective communication and feedback mechanisms essential for teamwork. Embark on your CBL EdVenture Quest! Engage with your peers and enhance your learning through collaboration and active participation!

NoteLiteral.En: Understand the philosophy and foundations of CBL (Challenge-Based Learning)
Demonstrate the application of CBL principles through case studies
Develop the ability and skills to cooperate in the CBL learning setting.

The learning outcomes are assessed as follows:  

LO 1: online activities; discussions in forums, self-reflection  

LO 2: mini projects, self-reflection, peer observation, teacher observation  

LO 3: mini-project, group discussions, self-reflection, peer observation  

The final mark is calculated as follows:

Forum discussions: 20%

Mini project: 50%

Group discussions & peer feedback: 20%

Teacher observation: 10%

This totals 100% of the final mark, reflecting a comprehensive evaluation of the learning outcomes achieved.
Navigating Real-World Challenges through Collaborative Exploration and Case Studies

This short course will help you immerse yourself in the transormative approach of Challenge-Based Learning (CBL). How? Through engaging, real-world case scenarios, you will be able to discover the principles of CBL and understand its methodologies. You will also be able to explore practical strategies to address real-world challenges effectively, foster creativity, collaborate with other peers, and develop your critical thinking skills as well as create your own meaningful learning experience.
